YouTube Channel

Videos and Gifs

 

Released Craft (1.05)

Cold War Blackbird Craft

Release Thread

Google Drive Download

Cold War Blackbird is a short film set in 1972 in an alternate Kerbal universe over the country of Kerbitnam. All the craft were from that time period in our universe but as far as I know no MiG 25's ever flew in Vietnam. However all the other craft were in Vietnam during that period. Where possible the planes have performance similar to their real counterparts. There are also ground vehicles and other accessories all stock. It was filmed in 1.05 and no effort has been made to update these craft to 1.1 yet. I would share the film versions but the changes would be difficult to replicate.

 

Space Shuttle Atlantis OV-104

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

Space Shuttle Atlantis OV-104 is a MK3 scale replica of the Space Shuttle. It is meant to be as realistic as possible, so the boosters are SRB's. There is a MK 2 version on the way that is much better with several mission payloads, so I would wait for that one rather than downloading this one.

 

SSTA KSS Voyager

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

A spaceplane that can SSTO from Kerbin with enough dV to go almost anywhere and land again. Once on another planet it can mine resources to refuel and then take off and go anywhere again. It can land like a conventional spaceplane using lift in atmosphere, and or it can use it's VTOL capabilities on all worlds for the last bit of landing (uses oxidiser really fast, save for absolutely the last minute).

 

Stock Duna Buggy

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

Along with some Vagani suspension (which will not stop things exploding if you jump the administration building like I did) it has about 500ms of dV (enough to get you to orbit on the Mun) *note: Warranty void if used off Kerbin.

Soviet T-54 Tank

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

A soviet era T-54 Tank replica with rotating turret and two BFG (Big Friendly Greeting) 0.625 rounds. 

 

K-1 Falcon Supersonic Bomber

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

It can super-cruise (half throttle) at almost Mach 4 and deliver 2 cruise missiles nearly anywhere on Kerbin if fully fuelled. Requires BDArmory for Nosecone, Targeting Pod, ECM, Chaff, Flares and Cruise Missiles.

 

Mining Platform (oil rig)

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

A Sea Based Mining Platform (like an oil rig). you can mine with it in very shallow water and dock a ship with it (possibly). 224 parts

 

Vought F4-U Corsair

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

A replica of the famous WWII navy/marines fighter, it auto takes off and is quite manoeuvrable and easy to fly. If you want the paint you need to install Kerbpaint and if you want decals you can make them using the Flag_Decals mod.

 

Air Carrier

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

Before Wernher worked for the KSC he was pilfered from the Kaiser where he worked on their Wunderwaffe (Wonder Weapon) program. There he created the Wunderwaffe Flugzeugträger Damocles and aircraft carrier that is capable of flight itself. It can also set down in the water and be used like a normal aircraft carrier.

 

US Army Jeep

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

A stock US Army jeep that is fun to drive and paint, if you want the colors you will need Kerbpaint. Now with machine gun! 95 parts

 

Blue Origin: New Shepard

 

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

Replica of the Blue Origin New Shepard. A Space Tourist ship for taking 6 passengers to the edge of space and returning booster and capsule seperately, the booster under power. Included Launch Tower for transferring Kerbals to the ship it is made up of 165 parts.

 

KG-12 Finch

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

A small, fast and manoeuvrable Ground Attack/Advanced Trainer with a couple of missiles and a bomb. The engine has been updated to the Panther and the missiles have been redone to be much more accurate.

 

Mini Soyuz

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

It's small, it's cute, whats not to like. A mini Soyuz to celebrate the anniversary of the original Soyuz on November 28th 1966. It's as complete as I can make it, includes LES, Korolev's cross on booster seperation and authentic capsule sounds (OK I'm just joking about that last one)

*Note need to update engine placement for Majorjim.

 

Space Shuttle Gargantua

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

Who said small things could not be fantastic, this ship packs a lot of fun into a very small package. A 1/3rd Scale replica of the NASA Space Shuttle it can deliver a small payload to 100km orbit. Included is a resource scanning satellite.

 

Seaplane Experimental S-EX 1

Release Thread

KerbalX Download

Every Kerbal playboy needs his own seaplane to fly dates to nearby deserted islands. And no one is more playboyish than our Kerbalnaughts. This island hopper boasts STOL on land or water and looks to impress anyone.

 

Work in Progress
Name Album Comment
Jool Grand Tour Spaceplane

An SSTO Spaceplane for the Jool Grand Tour that carries a Laythe SSTO Spaceplane Lander and a Tylo Lander that also lands on all the other bodies. It's all been tested using HyperEdit (The spaceplane itself has been flown to orbit the normal way), I just need the spare time to fly the mission.

   

 

   

 

   

 

   

 

De Havilland Mosquito

A replica of the famous Fighter/Bomber from WWII, temperature bugs shelved the project in 1.04, but the bug fixes in 1.05 mean a resurrection is possible.

The Dunatian, crafts and playable save file

 

Selfish Meme's Flag Pack

 

Non Upgraded Craft (1.04)
Name Album Release Download Comment
Vickers Wellington MK X                                                   Link KerbalX

A replica of the famous WWII bomber

Kakar R1 Link Download

An active suspension rover that happened to look a little like a Paris to Dakar racer

OrbitMaster Link KerbalX

Orange Tank to LKO and return 33% Payload Fraction, it's an optimised refuelling machine, it does not have docking ports, it just put's orange tanks in orbit, you will need a tug or some other craft to go fetch them.

Demonstrator Link KerbalX

Craft constructed for a KSP Controller Demo being run in Sydney, apparently it got some good use. Easy to fly with big margins, have a relaxed and easy trip to your space station, or even a Mun flyby for tourists.

Edited April 24, 2016 by selfish_meme

So news and plans, I released the Mini Soyuz last night and got a feature on Spacecraft Friday/Monday for the SE-X 1. That was great, was a pity the Mini Shuttle didn't get a feature or much notice, it was really nice. I have decided to put The Dunatian on hold until after 1.1 as I don't have time to do much other than update current other craft. I have finished a launcher for the Kerbes that I will add to it, but it needs updating too. As for current craft, the Finch has been updated but I want to work on the missiles a bit more. I will update some of the more popular craft like the Orbit Master as well. Sadly Project X has been killed by the changes to 1.05, it was very marginal anyway and the changes to the jets have made it unworkable. Lastly the destroyer I was working on for the WWII video looks like it needs a lot of work for the new buoyancy.

Front Page has had a lot of changes and is looking pretty nice, need some more changes to the format to get information density up so it's not so long.

Edited February 24, 2016 by selfish_meme
Remember to update posts rather than post again please guys :)

Just released the Blue Origins New Shepard replica, check it out here

Edited February 24, 2016 by selfish_meme
Well that's a bag of poo, it will take a while to get the first page back, or is that happening automagically?
Have added heapings of awesome to the OP, make sure you visit and check it out, it's worth it I promise, make sure to scroll to the end.

Editing front page

Added K-1 Falcon Supersonic Bomber
@Azimech added my flag pack to the OP if you wanted it, not many in there but it might save you a little time, don't ask about the silly one, it's for an upcoming video.

I made an opening credit video for my YouTube channel, I had sort of pictured how to do it for a while. Getting the right angle and perspective proved somewhat more difficult. I am happy enough with it for now. As I get better I will update it one day. I decided to give myself a studio name, because, why not. Deleted because later I realised it was 720p and I was adding it to my projects first causing them to all be 720p and I could not change them, this made them all artifacted and blocky - excrement.

 

Edited April 10, 2016 by selfish_meme

First video uploaded is a spoof of Top Gun I did, I downloaded an old F14 someone made and updated it to fly in 1.05, which it does very well, but I forgot to turn the gimbal off on the engines. Also I may need to check some of the control surfaces, they seem to be moving when they shouldn't, anyway enjoy.
Holy Moly @blackrack fixed up the ocean shaders for OpenGL, praise the dev!

5 hours ago, selfish_meme said:

Holy Moly @blackrack fixed up the ocean shaders for OpenGL, praise the dev!

It's not a perfect fix yet (minor pixelation remains) but I finally got the issue.
Red vs Blue something quick for @inigma and @BahamutoD

Hey man, here is one way of creating a BDArmory AI scenario...

Ok... what have I been working on? a TOP SECRET project that I can now reveal. I need testers for the first ever known BDArmory career contract! Accept this baby, and be presented with a very relevant mission for very relevant times...

 

Requires: KAX, Take Command, BDArmory, Contract Configurator all installed from CKAN, and the dev version of Contract Pack: Giving Aircraft a Purpose found here: https://github.com/inigmatus/GAP  (GAP gets installed into your GameData/ContractPacks folder.)

Let the AI clean up the opposition or get in there and help them yourself, BDArmory makes it possible.

So this is what has been happening lately, a little Vietnam era cinematic, I'm sharing these images as a bit of a teaser, also one is exclusive to this forum because I love it.

http://imgur.com/a/JgUpF

Edited February 27, 2016 by selfish_meme

OK, got distracted by the Duna Buggy and the MK3 SSTA that I released. I have been back editing and creating footage for the SR-71 cinematic, modded KSP is so gorgeous these days I often just want to sit and watch the sunset. I have finished the first sped up part, I do not want to be a stop motion animator its very tedious work. I have about an hour of flying footage to distill down to a few minutes and somehow bridge evening to morning.
What I like about your topic is the diversity and the quality of the builds. Keep up the good work!
